page.title: 03St.Peter's Church, Mawdesley
page.content: Mawdesley parish church was built in 1840. Before then, people went to Croston in carriages or on foot.The church was altered in 1880-1900, when they put in a centre aisle,a gallery, water pipes and a new entrance. The clergyman has always been called Rector. Approximately 100 people attend church. They travel from Mawdesley, Bispham and Wrightington. More people attend in the morning than in the evening. The church is run by the Rector, two churchwardens and a church council. The special events are Palm Sunday, Easter Sunday, Prize Giving, Mothering Sunday,Day School and Sunday School anniversaries, Harvest and Christmas. The church stands at the top of the hill, in High Street. The Rector lives at Bispham Green.
